A **freezing sphere**, e, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [sphere](/wiki/Sphere "Sphere") with an affinity to [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") that behaves like other spheres, and is the only one that does not [emit light](/wiki/Light_source "Light source").

Freezing spheres possess a cold [explosion attack](/wiki/Explosion_attack "Explosion attack") that can shatter [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") in the target's inventory, and possesses [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance").

The [spellbook of freeze sphere](/wiki/Spellbook_of_freeze_sphere "Spellbook of freeze sphere") is a [deferred feature](/wiki/Deferred_feature "Deferred feature") that teaches a spell the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") can use to create tame freezing spheres.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 6b60618e](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/6b60618e0e662b35b8e9c31dc9c4baee5ae70932), freezing spheres create explosions with their attacks, which cover a 3x3 area around them and affect items and other monsters caught within the blast radius - this does not count the inventory of a hero that is [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a freezing sphere and explodes. This is adapted from [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), and the sphere's [difficulty rating](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") is also raised to 9.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Randomly generated freezing spheres are always created hostile, and they will not be generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

A freezing sphere [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

## Strategy

Freezing spheres are fairly annoying to deal with, but their explosion attack can only destroy potions, making them the least hazardous to a hero's inventory. Pets that attack freezing spheres will likely take the explosion in your stead, and cold resistance completely trivializes them. Freezing spheres can also be made to miss if you are [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible") or [displaced](/wiki/Displaced "Displaced"), and their nonexistent [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") means they can easily be put to sleep or otherwise immobilized, allowing a hero or their pet to kill them before they can explode.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec6ea2821693a7131c97), extrinsic cold resistance protects the target's open inventory from damage by a freezing sphere explosion 99⁄100 of the time.

## History

The freezing sphere first appears in Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial bestiary for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0")—in Hack 1.21, the ice ball is a somewhat similar monster included in the bestiary.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), freezing spheres also have [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") and [hit as +2 weapons](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon").

SLASH'EM makes the spellbook of freeze sphere and its spell functional: freeze spheres summoned by the spell only exist for a temporary amount of time, and monsters hit by their explosions are treated as though the hero had attacked them, e.g. awarding them [experience](/wiki/Experience "Experience") for monsters that the sphere kills, blaming them for angering [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") monsters, and so on. The spell also respects [extinction](/wiki/Extinction "Extinction"), meaning it has a finite number of uses.

All of the above information also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), freezing spheres explode on death similar to [gas spores](/wiki/Gas_spore "Gas spore"), covering a 3x3 area centered on it that can burn items in the open inventory of monsters caught in the blast; extrinsic cold resistance can prevent both effects.

Freezing spheres may also be generated in [the Lawful Quest](/wiki/Law_quest_\(dNetHack\) "Law quest (dNetHack)"), where they will appear on the Paths of Law and within the Arcadian Tower if [Oona](/wiki/Oona "Oona")'s elemental affinity is set to cold. The [summon sphere](/index.php?title=Summon_sphere\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Summon sphere (page does not exist)") [monster spell](/wiki/DNetHack_monster_spells "DNetHack monster spells") can summon freezing spheres.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), the explosion attack of freezing spheres covers a 3x3 radius, affecting monsters and items caught in the explosion as well as items in the affected monsters' inventories; extrinsic cold resistance protects the open inventory from damage 99⁄100 of the time.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the spellbook of freeze sphere is made functional and works similar to SLASH'EM, and freezing spheres can also be created by [reading](/wiki/Reading "Reading") a [scroll of elementalism](/wiki/Scroll_of_elementalism "Scroll of elementalism") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused"). This also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the spellbook of freeze sphere is made functional and works similar to SLASH'EM, and freeze spheres created with the spell are not counted towards the [charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma")-based limit for [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet").

Freezing spheres explode on death similarly to gas spores: both their explosion attack and on-death explosions cover a 3x3 radius centered on its square, affecting monsters and items caught in the explosion.

## Encyclopedia entry

Freezing spheres share the entry below with other spheres:

The attack by those who want to die -- this is the attack against which you cannot prepare a perfect defense.  
                       --Human aphorism

\[ The Dosadi Experiment, by Frank Herbert ]
